title: Two-Year Full-time MBA Curriculum | Cornell Johnson
raw_text:
Two-Year MBA Program Curriculum
We recently enhanced our core curriculum at Johnson to increase the benefits of our
Two-Year MBA program
after surveying more than 1,000 corporate recruiters and alumni.
As a result, our graduates now achieve a faster and more significant return on investment, improving their opportunities for career advancement and success.
At the heart of our enhanced curriculum are three basic principles that provide the foundation for our program:
The value of a solid education in all key business functions, including marketing, finance, human resources, and production
The importance of strong analytical and decision-making skills
A focus on offering the greatest flexibility in tailoring individual curricula
These core principles have guided the development of our Two-Year MBA program curriculum, enabling Johnson to provide an unmatched learning experience for our students to better prepare them for working and winning in the new global economy.
“Immersions give you an opportunity to learn about an industry that you are passionate about. I was surprised that I was able to acquire an extremely deep level of knowledge in such a short time to help my client solve their specific problem.”
Preet Jassi, MBA '18
Roy H. Park Leadership Fellows Program
Full-tuition fellowships + a significant service project – awarded to a select group of U.S. citizens with outstanding leadership potential.
Read More about the Park Fellows

extracted_fields.school: With hundreds of options across Cornell University
extracted_fields.features: Enhanced core curriculum with focus on key business functions, analytical skills, and flexibility. Includes industry-specific coursework, team-based learning, and personalized mentorship.

chunks.text: Two-Year MBA Program Curriculum We recently enhanced our core curriculum at Johnson to increase the benefits of our Two-Year MBA program after surveying more than 1,000 corporate recruiters and alumni. As a result, our graduates now achieve a faster and more significant return on investment, improving their opportunities for career advancement and success. At the heart of our enhanced curriculum are three basic principles that provide the foundation for our program: The value of a solid education in all key business functions, including marketing, finance, human resources, and production The importance of strong analytical and decision-making skills A focus on offering the greatest flexibility in tailoring individual curricula These core principles have guided the development of our Two-Year MBA program curriculum, enabling Johnson to provide an unmatched learning experience for our students to better prepare them for working and winning in the new global economy. “Immersions give you an opportunity to learn about an industry that you are passionate about. I was surprised that I was able to acquire an extremely deep level of knowledge in such a short time to help my client solve their specific problem.” Preet Jassi, MBA '18 Roy H. Park Leadership Fellows Program Full-tuition fellowships + a significant service project – awarded to a select group of U.S. citizens with outstanding leadership potential. Read More about the Park Fellows Two-Year MBA Core Curriculum Courses Advanced business fundamentals form the foundation of our Two-Year MBA. In the Two-Year MBA program , you’ll spend your first year acquiring key business management knowledge that will prove crucial for leadership roles in today’s global, digital economy. Our core curriculum—designed with input from alumni and corporate recruiters—focuses on developing leadership and analytical skills through coursework and core teams , hands-on modeling work, critical thinking, and case competitions at different stages of the core. By the time you start your internship, you will have finished the core and completed a specialized industry immersion, which will position you for success and enable you to stand out among your summer colleagues. Fall Semester During your first semester, you will learn vital business management concepts in the following courses: Core Teams Practicum Leading Teams Financial Accounting Microeconomics for Management Marketing Management Critical and Strategic Thinking Managerial Finance Strategy Spring Semester In your second semester, your core courses will dive into data modeling, AI, and analytics and the management of business operations: Managing Operations Data Analytics and Modeling These courses are completed alongside your immersion in one of five areas. You can also begin taking elective courses during your second semester. Immersion Learning One Semester. Endless Potential. At the Samuel Curtis Johnson Graduate School of Management, your second semester in the two-year MBA program is dedicated to intensive, integrated learning centered on a specific industry or career path. We call this collective experience an immersion, and it’s one of the key

In your second semester, your core courses will dive into data modeling, AI, and analytics and the management of business operations: Managing Operations Data Analytics and Modeling These courses are completed alongside your immersion in one of five areas. You can also begin taking elective courses during your second semester. Immersion Learning One Semester. Endless Potential. At the Samuel Curtis Johnson Graduate School of Management, your second semester in the two-year MBA program is dedicated to intensive, integrated learning centered on a specific industry or career path. We call this collective experience an immersion, and it’s one of the key distinctions of the Johnson School MBA. Led by outstanding faculty and guided by expert business practitioners, each immersion is ripe with real-world learning experiences that prepare you for success in your chosen field. Core Courses Immersions are designed to give you foundational knowledge and develop key skills in your area of interest. Your core courses set the stage for the entire semester-long experience. Elective Classes You can enhance your experience by choosing electives that align with your career goals or pique your interest. With hundreds of options across Cornell University, you can truly make this immersion your own. Hands-on Experience Seeing concepts in action is a major component of immersions. From field trips and competitions to client consulting projects and global travel, you’ll find ways to apply what you’re learning. Corporate Finance Rooted in the principles of shareholder value creation, this immersion prepares you to become a sophisticated decision-maker and strategic thinker capable of integrating operational and financial insights into your work. Digital Technology Digital tech is embedded in today’s business landscape from big data to blockchain. In this immersion, you will develop skills to lead in the tech sector and anywhere digital products and services are delivered to customers. Investment Banking This immersion will boost your banking acumen as you learn from leading faculty members, analyze landmark transactions, receive coaching from top investment bankers, and visit Wall Street. Strategy & Consulting In this immersion, students build the mindset, behaviors, and skills to succeed as a consultant, whether for a large consultancy, in a specialized boutique, or within a Fortune 500 company. Strategic Product & Marketing Whether you want to work in consumer packaged goods or digital products and services, this immersion will grow your understanding of consumer behavior and economic trends. Customized Immersion If you have niche interests rather

Investment Banking This immersion will boost your banking acumen as you learn from leading faculty members, analyze landmark transactions, receive coaching from top investment bankers, and visit Wall Street. Strategy & Consulting In this immersion, students build the mindset, behaviors, and skills to succeed as a consultant, whether for a large consultancy, in a specialized boutique, or within a Fortune 500 company. Strategic Product & Marketing Whether you want to work in consumer packaged goods or digital products and services, this immersion will grow your understanding of consumer behavior and economic trends. Customized Immersion If you have niche interests rather than a broad focus, a custom immersion allows you to build your path based on your own career pursuits and leverage your training in other fields and disciplines. “The immersion program featured an impressive array of speakers, including industry experts, alumni, and senior leaders from various fields. These speakers not only shared their insights, but also provided inspiration and real-world context for the concepts we were learning.” —Chukwujindu Awele Juwah MBA ’24 Summer Internship The summer internship is a hallmark experience of the Cornell MBA. Many students pursue a placements related to their immersion area. Areas of Focus Deepen your subject matter expertise by completing one of our career-supporting areas of focus , aligning your remaining electives with your goals. Centers & Institutes Business innovation is happening within the college’s many centers and institutes (C&Is) and you’ll have ample opportunities to get involved. Student Organizations Career-oriented student clubs across the SC Johnson College and across the university offer workshops, recruiting events, networking, and more. Take the Next Step If the innovative curriculum and immersive learning experiences at the Johnson School sound like the right fit for you, we encourage you to apply to our two-year MBA program. Apply now Two-Year MBA Electives Johnson’s highly flexible Two-Year MBA enables you to get started sooner on a custom-tailored course of study No other MBA program enables you to advance your studies – and your career – as quickly as our Two-Year MBA. In just the first semester, you’ll gain a solid foundation in advanced business skills and knowledge, enabling you to start individual, career-focused study during the second semester. But your ability to custom-tailor your learning really takes off during the second year. You can choose to structure your electives around one or more areas of focus. Johnson offers 12 focus areas

MBA Electives Johnson’s highly flexible Two-Year MBA enables you to get started sooner on a custom-tailored course of study No other MBA program enables you to advance your studies – and your career – as quickly as our Two-Year MBA. In just the first semester, you’ll gain a solid foundation in advanced business skills and knowledge, enabling you to start individual, career-focused study during the second semester. But your ability to custom-tailor your learning really takes off during the second year. You can choose to structure your electives around one or more areas of focus. Johnson offers 12 focus areas that can complement your immersion and help you develop specialized skills and experience. Learn more about focus areas for Two-Year MBAs . In addition to at least 80 electives to choose from at Johnson, you can further focus and enhance your learning with thousands of other courses at all the other top-ranked colleges, schools, and multidisciplinary centers at Cornell. You’ll gain an unmatched, competitive edge with a wide range of courses taught by nationally and internationally recognized experts in Cornell’s schools of law , engineering , and more. In fact, the breadth and depth of knowledge available throughout the Cornell family of institutions has led a number of our MBA candidates to enroll in a dual degree program . Students also have the opportunity to accelerate their leadership development through our suite of leadership opportunities , which are available throughout your two years at Johnson. Two-Year MBA Areas of Focus After completing an immersion during your first year in the Two-Year MBA program, you can choose to structure your second-year electives around one or more areas of focus. Choosing a focus area is optional and it is not requirement for the Two-Year MBA curriculum; however, narrowing your electives around a specialized focus area or two can help deepen your expertise and position you for career success in a specific field or industry. To complete an area of focus, you must finish nine credits of corresponding elective courses in that area. Johnson offers 12 areas of focus that support a wide range of career paths: Asset Management/Investment Research Brand Management Consulting & Strategy Corporate Finance Data Modeling & Analytics Emerging Markets Entrepreneurship & Innovation Investment Banking Leadership & Ethics Private Equity & Venture Capital Sustainable Global Enterprise Technology Product Management Asset Management/Investment Research The asset management/investment research area of focus is

specialized focus area or two can help deepen your expertise and position you for career success in a specific field or industry. To complete an area of focus, you must finish nine credits of corresponding elective courses in that area. Johnson offers 12 areas of focus that support a wide range of career paths: Asset Management/Investment Research Brand Management Consulting & Strategy Corporate Finance Data Modeling & Analytics Emerging Markets Entrepreneurship & Innovation Investment Banking Leadership & Ethics Private Equity & Venture Capital Sustainable Global Enterprise Technology Product Management Asset Management/Investment Research The asset management/investment research area of focus is best for students pursuing careers in asset management, corporate finance, investment banking, and investment research. Sample coursework in asset management/investment research: Advanced Financial Statement Analysis Applied Portfolio Management ( The Cayuga Fund ) Behavioral Finance Financial Modeling Fixed Income Securities & Interest Rate Options Intermediate Accounting Investment & Portfolio Management Managerial Accounting & Reporting Taxation & Business Strategy Brand Management This area of focus is best for students planning to launch careers in brand management. Sample coursework in brand management: Consumer Behavior Customer Strategy & Analytics Data-Driven Marketing Digital Marketing Marketing Research Product Marketing Insights Retail Operations Strategy & Tactics of Pricing Supply Chain Strategy Consulting & Strategy The consulting & strategy area of focus is ideal for students pursuing management consulting, internal consulting, and general management; however, this area of focus can fit with nearly any career ambition. Courses are taught by both academic faculty and senior consulting industry professionals. Sample coursework in consulting & strategy: Advanced Critical Thinking Cases in Business Strategy Cases in Strategic Management Evaluating Capital Investment Projects Game Theory & Business Strategy Management Cases Management Practicum Platform Strategy Problem-Solving Project Process Product Market Insights Rivalry & Cooperation Supply Chain Strategy Taxes & Business Strategy Corporate Finance This area of focus is best for students pursuing corporate finance, general management, or management consulting. Sample coursework in corporate finance: Advanced Financial Statement Analysis Corporate Financial Policy Corporate Governance Entrepreneurial Finance Global Macroeconomics News & Events Intermediate Accounting International Finance Introduction to Macroeconomic Management Accounting & Reporting Managerial Spreadsheet Modeling Data Modeling & Analytics The data modeling & analytics area of focus is best for students interested in business and/or marketing analytics and modeling; however, this area of focus can fit with nearly any career ambition. Sample coursework in data modeling & analytics: Advanced Data Analytics Advanced Spreadsheet

Finance This area of focus is best for students pursuing corporate finance, general management, or management consulting. Sample coursework in corporate finance: Advanced Financial Statement Analysis Corporate Financial Policy Corporate Governance Entrepreneurial Finance Global Macroeconomics News & Events Intermediate Accounting International Finance Introduction to Macroeconomic Management Accounting & Reporting Managerial Spreadsheet Modeling Data Modeling & Analytics The data modeling & analytics area of focus is best for students interested in business and/or marketing analytics and modeling; however, this area of focus can fit with nearly any career ambition. Sample coursework in data modeling & analytics: Advanced Data Analytics Advanced Spreadsheet Modeling Data-Driven Marketing Designing Data Products Financial Modeling Introduction to SQL and Tableau Managerial Spreadsheet Modeling Marketing Research Supply Chain Analytics Technology Management: Cloud Computing & Big Data Dual Campus Weekend Courses in New York City Programming and data mining courses offered by Cornell’s School of Computing and Information Science and the College of Engineering Emerging Markets This area of focus is best for students wishing to understand the role of emerging markets in the global economy and those who want to work on issues related to emerging multinationals, innovation, and corporate social responsibility in emerging markets. The emerging markets focus area is associated with the Emerging Markets Fellows program. Sample coursework in emerging markets: Competition from Emerging Markets Current Global Issues for Business: The US, Europe, China, and Emerging Markets Doing Business in China Experience in International Management (various global locations) International Finance Global Macroeconomics News & Events Leaders in Emerging Markets Entrepreneurship & Innovation This area of focus is ideal for students with entrepreneurial ambitions and/or those who view intrapreneurship skills as critical to their chosen career paths. Many of Johnson’s entrepreneurship and innovation courses are popular elective options for students from across Cornell, including PhD students in engineering or agricultural science. The connections made across disciplines in these courses have led to some of Cornell’s most successful startup ventures. Sample coursework in entrepreneurship & innovation: Actualizing Your Startup I Actualizing Your Startup II Big Red Tech Strategy Business Idea Factory Design & Innovation Designing New Ventures Entrepreneurial Finance Global Innovation & Technology Commercialization Leading Agile Innovation Social Entrepreneurship Startup Learning Series Strategic Management of Technology & Innovation Tech Commercialization and Entrepreneurship Investment Banking This area of focus if best for students who have completed the investment banking immersion and who will be pursing a career in investment

engineering or agricultural science. The connections made across disciplines in these courses have led to some of Cornell’s most successful startup ventures. Sample coursework in entrepreneurship & innovation: Actualizing Your Startup I Actualizing Your Startup II Big Red Tech Strategy Business Idea Factory Design & Innovation Designing New Ventures Entrepreneurial Finance Global Innovation & Technology Commercialization Leading Agile Innovation Social Entrepreneurship Startup Learning Series Strategic Management of Technology & Innovation Tech Commercialization and Entrepreneurship Investment Banking This area of focus if best for students who have completed the investment banking immersion and who will be pursing a career in investment banking. Sample coursework in investment banking: Advanced Financial Statement Analysis Behavioral Finance Derivative Securities Part I and Part II Finance & Ethics Financial Distress, Bankruptcy & Restructuring Financial Markets & Institutions Introduction to Macroeconomics Investment & Portfolio Management Mergers & Acquisitions – Accounting, Modeling & Evaluation of Deals Valuation Principles Dual Campus Weekend Courses in New York City Leadership & Ethics This area of focus is can provide value for all MBA students regardless of their chosen career path or industry. Sample coursework in leadership & ethics: Core Leadership Skills for a VUCA World Crisis Communication for Business Leaders Ethical Decision Making in Management Finance & Ethics Johnson Leadership Fellows Leading Across Differences: Understanding Identity, Dialogue, and Influence Power and Politics in Organizations Topics in Leadership: Women in the Workplace Private Equity & Venture Capital This area of focus is best for students pursuing careers in venture capital and private equity. The capstone in this area of focus is completed though Big Red Ventures , a student organization in which students manage a venture capital fund under the guidance of faculty advisors throughout the year. Sample coursework in private equity & venture capital: Case Studies in Venture Financing Designing New Ventures Entrepreneurial Finance Intensive PE Practicum Negotiation Essentials Venture Capital Apprenticeship Sustainable Global Enterprise The sustainable global enterprise area of focus is ideal for students who aspire to address social and environmental issues though innovation, market development, and entrepreneurship. Sample coursework in sustainable global enterprise: Advanced Topics in Sustainability Big Red Microenterprise Finance & Sustainable Global Enterprise Colloquium Leaders in Sustainable Global Enterprise Social Entrepreneurship Strategies for Sustainability Topics in ESG Investing Technology Product Management This area of focus is best for students pursuing careers in product management, technical product management, product marketing, and other functions within the tech industry.

Ventures Entrepreneurial Finance Intensive PE Practicum Negotiation Essentials Venture Capital Apprenticeship Sustainable Global Enterprise The sustainable global enterprise area of focus is ideal for students who aspire to address social and environmental issues though innovation, market development, and entrepreneurship. Sample coursework in sustainable global enterprise: Advanced Topics in Sustainability Big Red Microenterprise Finance & Sustainable Global Enterprise Colloquium Leaders in Sustainable Global Enterprise Social Entrepreneurship Strategies for Sustainability Topics in ESG Investing Technology Product Management This area of focus is best for students pursuing careers in product management, technical product management, product marketing, and other functions within the tech industry. Sample coursework in technology product management: Building a Consumer Internet Business Design and Innovation Designing Data Products Designing New Ventures Disruptive Technologies Electronic Commerce Leading Agile Innovation Platform Strategy Product Marketing Insights Strategic Management of Technology and Innovation Dual Campus Weekend Courses in New York City ==== COURSE DETAIL START (Two-Year MBA Program Curriculum) ==== Our Programs Why Johnson? Industry Advantage Request Information Full-Time MBA Programs Our full-time MBA programs — a two-year residential option in Ithaca, NY, and a one-year tech-focused MBA based in New York City, and a dual-campus option offering the best of both — develop leaders who impact and influence the global marketplace. Both programs provide industry-specific coursework, team-based learning, and personalized mentorship. VIEW FULL-TIME MBA PROGRAMS Executive MBA Programs Built on the strength of rigorous academics and designed for working professionals, our EMBA programs allow you to advance your career without interruption — and incorporate what you’re learning immediately. Learn in New York City or through a distributed classroom in one of 20+ cities across the Americas. Discover EMBA Options Master's Programs From analytics to accounting, specialized options at the Johnson School deepen your knowledge and expand your career opportunities. We offer several STEM-designated business degree programs in Management , Accounting , and Business Analytics , along with a fully-funded PhD program —all designed to sharpen your professional focus. Explore Potential Paths Collaborative Cornell Community Our intentionally small programs foster close bonds with your cohort, faculty, and alumni. You’ll find many opportunities to connect—across degree programs and throughout Cornell—building relationships that support your growth during the program and for life. These connections also open doors to valuable mentorship and career opportunities long after graduation. High-Impact, Hands-On Approach Students dive into their chosen area of interest after the first semester, positioning them for specialized summer internships.

degree programs in Management , Accounting , and Business Analytics , along with a fully-funded PhD program —all designed to sharpen your professional focus. Explore Potential Paths Collaborative Cornell Community Our intentionally small programs foster close bonds with your cohort, faculty, and alumni. You’ll find many opportunities to connect—across degree programs and throughout Cornell—building relationships that support your growth during the program and for life. These connections also open doors to valuable mentorship and career opportunities long after graduation. High-Impact, Hands-On Approach Students dive into their chosen area of interest after the first semester, positioning them for specialized summer internships. They build expertise through the college’s centers and institutes —spanning emerging markets , sustainability , investing , family business , and more. Pair that with leadership courses and international study trips and these experiences equip graduates to make an impact in business. Innovating for the Future We stay ahead of emerging trends so our students can lead and shape the business marketplace. The Johnson School has pioneered advancements such as distance education , the first Tech MBA , the first EMBA in Healthcare Leadership , an online MSBA program , a dual-campus model , and coursework in artificial intelligence. Through our innovative curriculum and placing students in their area of focus earlier, we equip them to think from multiple perspectives, adapt quickly, and develop deep expertise. Leadership Rooted in Innovation and Impact Dean Vishal Gaur leads the Johnson School with a focus on innovation, global impact, and excellence in research, teaching, and industry engagement. Under his guidance, faculty lead influential research and graduates secure top roles in investment banking and consulting. Learn More About the Dean Expert Faculty, Personalized Mentorship, Real-World Experience Johnson School faculty are recognized leaders and dedicated mentors who bring their research and industry experience directly into the classroom. They work hands-on with students, offering guidance, feedback, and insight to prepare them for success in business leadership roles. Explore College Faculty Alumni Drive Student Success and School Growth Johnson School alumni actively mentor students, return to campus to speak, hire graduates, and support the school financially. As global business leaders and CEOs, they lead with purpose—creating innovative, sustainable, and socially impactful businesses. Their engagement strengthens our community and fuels future innovation and success. December 8, 2025 AI chatbots can effectively sway voters – in either direction A short interaction with a chatbot can meaningfully shift a voter’s opinion about a presidential candidate or proposed policy in either direction, new Cornell research finds. December 3, 2025 Video-call glitches can have serious consequences Video call glitches — even without disrupting conversation — can break the illusion of being face-to-face and feel uncanny, Cornell-led research finds Our Dynamic Campuses in Ithaca & NYC While our business graduate degrees vary in length, format, and focus, each includes a residential component. On campus at Cornell — whether for two years or a few weeks — you’ll have access to high-tech facilities and get to walk the halls of some of the most historic academic buildings in the country. Experience a glimpse of our Ithaca, NY, and New York City campuses from wherever you are. Explore Our Campuses Next Steps: Where Will Johnson Take You? Whether you want to learn more about Cornell University’s graduate programs in business or are ready to apply, the SC Johnson College admissions team can answer your questions and support you through the application process. High-Impact, Hands-On Approach Students dive into their chosen area of interest after the first semester, positioning them for specialized summer internships. They build expertise through the college’s centers and institutes —spanning emerging markets , sustainability , investing , family business , and more. Pair that with leadership courses and international study trips and these experiences equip graduates to make an impact in business. Innovating for the Future We stay ahead of emerging trends so our students can lead and shape the business marketplace. The Johnson School has pioneered advancements such as distance education , the first Tech MBA , the first EMBA in Healthcare Leadership , an online MSBA program , a dual-campus model , and coursework in artificial intelligence. Through our innovative curriculum and placing students in their area of focus earlier, we equip them to think from multiple perspectives, adapt quickly, and develop deep expertise. Leadership Rooted in Innovation and Impact Dean Vishal Gaur leads the Johnson School with a focus on innovation, global impact, and excellence in research, teaching, and industry engagement. Under his guidance, faculty lead influential research and graduates secure top roles in investment banking and consulting. Learn More About the Dean Expert Faculty, Personalized Mentorship, Real-World Experience Johnson School faculty are recognized leaders and dedicated mentors who bring their research and industry experience directly into the classroom. They work hands-on with students, offering guidance, feedback, and insight to prepare them for success in business leadership roles. Explore College Faculty Alumni Drive Student Success and School Growth Johnson School alumni actively mentor students, return to campus to speak, hire graduates, and support the school financially. As global business leaders and CEOs, they lead with purpose—creating innovative, sustainable, and socially impactful businesses. Their engagement strengthens our community and fuels future innovation and success.

Industry Advantage Request Information Full-Time MBA Programs Our full-time MBA programs — a two-year residential option in Ithaca, NY, and a one-year tech-focused MBA based in New York City, and a dual-campus option offering the best of both — develop leaders who impact and influence the global marketplace. Both programs provide industry-specific coursework, team-based learning, and personalized mentorship. VIEW FULL-TIME MBA PROGRAMS Executive MBA Programs Built on the strength of rigorous academics and designed for working professionals, our EMBA programs allow you to advance your career without interruption — and incorporate what you’re learning immediately. Learn in New York City or through a distributed classroom in one of 20+ cities across the Americas. Discover EMBA Options Master's Programs From analytics to accounting, specialized options at the Johnson School deepen your knowledge and expand your career opportunities. We offer several STEM-designated business degree programs in Management , Accounting , and Business Analytics , along with a fully-funded PhD program —all designed to sharpen your professional focus. Explore Potential Paths Collaborative Cornell Community Our intentionally small programs foster close bonds with your cohort, faculty, and alumni. You’ll find many opportunities to connect—across degree programs and throughout Cornell—building relationships that support your growth during the program and for life. These connections also open doors to valuable mentorship and career opportunities long after graduation.
